item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Debian bookworm live images now reproducible (175 points | 37 comments)
2. OpenAI adds MCP support to Agents SDK (20 points | 2 comments)
3. Good-bye core types; Hello Go as we know and love it (89 points | 12 comments)
4. Malware found on NPM infecting local package with reverse shell (16 points | 2 comments)
5. Sharding Pgvector (29 points | 4 comments)
6. Airline Demand Between Canada and United States Collapses, Down 70%+ (25 points | 6 comments)
7. A love letter to the CSV format (142 points | 121 comments)
8. MCP server for Ghidra (56 points | 9 comments)
9. Kilo Code: Speedrunning open source coding AI (32 points | 26 comments)
10. Weave (YC W25) is hiring a founding product engineer ( | hide)
11. Coordinating the Superbowl's visual fidelity with Elixir (565 points | 137 comments)
12. Google’s two-year frenzy to catch up with OpenAI (72 points | 74 comments)
13. Microsoft Study: AI Makes Human Cognition "Atrophied and Unprepared" (102 points | 51 comments)
14. Gemma3 Function Calling (31 points | 3 comments)
15. Heap-overflowing Llama.cpp to RCE (189 points | 40 comments)
16. Writing Programs with Ncurses (4 points | 1 comment)
17. Linux kernel 6.14 is a big leap forward in performance and Windows compatibility (109 points | 63 comments)
18. Has the decline of knowledge work begun? (54 points | 32 comments)
19. 'Naive' science fan faces jail for plutonium import (61 points | 26 comments)
20. Fragment of a human face aged over one million years discovered (51 points | 28 comments)
21. Google will develop Android OS behind closed doors starting next week (26 points | 11 comments)
22. An Interview with Zen Chief Architect Mike Clark (77 points | 2 comments)
23. A glitch in an online survey replaced the word 'yes' with 'forks' (74 points | 22 comments)
24. Botswana Successfully Launches First Satellite, Botsat-1 (11 points | 1 comment)
25. High-Performance PNG Decoding (48 points | 3 comments)
26. Trapping misbehaving bots in an AI Labyrinth (181 points | 132 comments)
27. Hyperlight WASM: Fast, secure, and OS-free (164 points | 58 comments)
28. Pi Pico Rx – A crystal radio for the digital age? (110 points | 12 comments)
29. Fast columnar JSON decoding with arrow-rs (35 points | 6 comments)
30. Servo vs. Ladybird (34 points | 12 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Wednesday, March 26, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
